definitions: Asafoetida is the English name for the dried latex (gum oleoresin) exuded from the rhizome or tap root of several species of Ferula, a perennial herb that grows 1 to 1.5 m (3.3 to 4.9 ft) tall
It is also known as food of the gods, devil's dung, jowani badian, hing, hengu, inguva, kayam, and ting
